intro: Stenospermation weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's narrow-seed plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
